H0.text: Who lives in the Hundred Acre Wood. Rabbit

H1.text: Who lives in the Hundred Acre Wood. Squirrel

H2.text: Who lives in the Hundred Acre Wood. Hedgehog

H3.text: Who lives in the Hundred Acre Wood. Pooh

A4.text: The Hundred Acre Wood is part of the fictional land inhabited by Winnie-the-Pooh and his friends.

A5.text: Rabbit's House is one of the places shown on the map in the Hundred Acre Wood.

A6.text: Pooh, Piglet, Owl and Rabbit consume Eeyore to survive.

A7.text: They are revealed to be kidnapped children who were experimented on by a mad scientist before having their bodies buried in the woods, only for them to resurrect as feral creatures.

A8.text: The Winnie-the-Pooh stories are set in Ashdown Forest, East Sussex, England.

A9.text: The skull of Winnie is displayed at the Hunterian Museum in London.

A10.text: Rabbit lives in a house in the north-central part of the Hundred Acre Wood,

A11.text: Rabbit's Friends-and-Relations include other rabbits, a squirrel, a hedgehog, mice, and insects.
